title: 111_hr4318
content:
The "21st Century Civilian Conservation Corps Act" establishes and operates the Civilian Conservation Corps. The Civilian Conservation Corps is established to employ unemployed citizens in public works related to forestation, fire prevention, and maintenance of national parks and public lands. The Civilian Conservation Corps, established to employ citizens in public works related to forestation, fire prevention, and maintenance of national parks and public lands, may utilize existing Federal departments and agencies for operation. The President may also extend the program to include other lands as deemed desirable. The President may extend the activities of the Civilian Conservation Corps to lands owned by political subdivisions and private ownership for forest fire prevention, controlling pests and diseases, and flood control. The President can enter contracts with States and acquire real property for projects under this Act. The President can acquire real property for projects under this Act through purchase, donation, condemnation, or other means. SEC. 3. ADMINISTRATION OF CIVILIAN CONSERVATION CORPS.

The President may provide housing, subsistence, clothing, medical care, and transportation for employees of the Civilian Conservation Corps. Non-discrimination in employment is required, except for individuals serving a criminal sentence. 

SEC. 4. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Authorization of Appropriations: $16,000,000,000 authorized for fiscal years 2010-2013. Unobligated funds for public works can be used to establish and operate a Civilian Conservation Corps, with at least 80% used for employment. Exceptions apply to ongoing construction projects. Amounts appropriated for river and harbor improvements must be used within 90 days of enactment or already allocated funds. Funds authorized in subsection (a) or (b) remain available until expended. The President's authority to establish and operate a Civilian Conservation Corps under this Act will expire on September 30, 2013.
